document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Afrotropical species of Asura Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera: Arctiidae, Lithosiinae), with the description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Afrotropical species of Asura Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera: Arctiidae, Lithosiinae), with the description of a new genus

heading.emphasis:
Afrasura indecisa (Walker, 1869 )
comb. n. , stat. rev.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Barsine indecisa Walker, 1869
, Proc. N. H. Soc. Glasg. I: 325 .

Asura xantha Bethune-Baker, 1911
, Ann. Mag. Nat. H. 8 : 537 ; syn. n.

Type locality.
Congo ( type 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 1 BMNH , examined). At the time of the description of
indecisa
the high basin of the Congo river was called “ Congo ” along with the lands on the left of the Congo river after its confluence with the Ubangi river: these lands are today part of the Democratic Republic of the Congo .

Distribution. Ghana , Kumasi. Nigeria , Port Harcourt. Ethiopia , Menegesha-Suba State forest (
Afrasura indecisa orientalis
ssp.n.
). Democratic Republic of the Congo . Ruwenzori [ Uganda ]. Angola .

Material examined. Gold Coast [ Ghana ]: 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 309 BMNH ; Kumasi 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 5845 BMNH . Nigeria : 11 3 in author coll. Ethiopia : 6 3 in author coll. Congo , Ubanghi R.: Ƥ Arct. g.sl. n. 5749 BMNH . Democratic Republic of the Congo : type 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 1 BMNH . Uganda : 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 6, 10 , 11 BMNH . Angola : type of
Asura xantha Bethune-Baker 1911
; 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 2 BMNH ; 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 5737 BMNH ; 3 Arct. g.sl. n. 5846 BMNH .

species from within the BMNH series of
Miltochrista craigii

FIGURES 13–24 .
Adults of
Afrasura

A. numida

A. obliterata
.

Diagnosis.
Afrasura indecisa
presents the ala valvae ending uniformly slender and longer than the supravalva. The species is similar to
A. discocellularis
and
A. obliterata
and also resembles
Afrasura rivulosa
. However, the genitalia are distinctive: the distal portion of ala valvae is long and slender in
indecisa
, and short and large in
rivulosa
with an evident thorn-like process. The female ductus bursae in
indecisa
is on average large and long without a discernible antrum, whereas in
rivulosa
there is a short and large antrum with a short and membranous ductus bursae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–36. Adults of
Afrasura
and related genera.
Afrasura
: 25,
A. pallescens
. 26–27,
A. peripherica hilara
. 28– 29,
A. rivulosa rivulosa
. 30,
A. rivulosa ethiopica .
31,
A. submarmorata
. 32,
A. terlineata
. Related genera: 33,
Asura cervicalis
. 34,
Asura lydia
. 35, "
Asura " phaeosticta
. 36,
" Asura " pectinella
.

FIGURES 37–40. Adults of related genera. 37,
" Asura " pectinella
. 38,
Tumicla sagenaria
. 39,
Tumicla atricraspeda
. 40,
Xanthetis spurrelli
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Coremata between seventh and eighth abdominal sterna dimple-shaped; one Nigerian specimen shows a small papillar extension in cephalic direction on the bottom of the corematal invagination. Male genitalia have the costa of the valva with the characteristic undulation; the two distal ends of the valva are both slender: the supravalvar one is shorter, slightly larger and less sclerotized than the one of the ala valvae. Saccus slightly deeper than the other species of
Afrasura
. Vesica with a slender cornutus long three fifth of the whole aedeagus; a small cluster of tiny thorns on the vesica and a bigger one of small thorns at the distal end of the aedeagus. Female pheromone dorsal gland a little longer than the posterior apophyses. The female presents the seventh abdominal segment membranous and has small pleural pouches between A 6 and A 7 . Female genitalia with ductus relatively long and large: it has an annular sclerotization at its conjunction with the bursa. Cervix membranous, sub-conical; corpus bursae membranous, covered inside by small thorn on left side; a small dimple-shaped signum.

Remarks.
Barsine indecisa
had been synonymized with
Asura obliterata
by
Hampson ( 1900 )
, but comparison to the genitalia of
obliterata
indicates it should be restored to species rank. The male specimens with g.sl. Arct.
10, 11
, 309, 5737 , 5845, 5846 BMNH , that were part of the series of
Asura obliterata
, are now considered to belong to
Afrasura indecisa
as they conform to the male genitalia of the type of
indecisa
.
Asura xantha
had been synonymized with
Asura obliterata
by
Hampson ( 1914 )
, but the examination of the genitalia of its type shows it to be conspecific with
indecisa
.
Kühne ( 2005
, 2008 ) synonymized
Asura discocellularis
with
Asura indecisa Walker
, but in the present work they are considered to be different species (see diagnosis under the description of
discocellularis
).
